an10.83:1.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā puṇṇiyo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā puṇṇiyo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
an10.83:1.1.eng: Then Venerable Puṇṇiya went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:

an10.83:1.2.pli: “ko nu kho, bhante, hetu ko paccayo yena appekadā tathāgataṃ dhammadesanā paṭibhāti appekadā nappaṭibhātī”ti?
an10.83:1.2.eng: “Sir, what is the cause, what is the reason why sometimes the Realized One feels inspired to teach, and other times not?”

an10.83:2.1.pli: “Saddho ca, puṇṇiya, bhikkhu hoti, no ca upasaṅkamitā; neva tāva tathāgataṃ dhammadesanā paṭibhāti.
an10.83:2.1.eng: “Puṇṇiya, when a mendicant has faith but doesn’t approach, the Realized One doesn’t feel inspired to teach.

an10.83:2.2.pli: Yato ca kho, puṇṇiya, bhikkhu saddho ca hoti upasaṅkamitā ca, evaṃ tathāgataṃ dhammadesanā paṭibhāti.
an10.83:2.2.eng: But when a mendicant has faith and approaches, the Realized One feels inspired to teach.

an10.83:3.1.pli: Saddho ca, puṇṇiya, bhikkhu hoti upasaṅkamitā ca, no ca payirupāsitā …pe…
an10.83:3.1.eng: When a mendicant has faith and approaches, but doesn’t pay homage …

an10.83:3.2.eng: they pay homage, but don’t ask questions …

an10.83:3.3.pli: paripucchitā ca, no ca ohitasoto dhammaṃ suṇāti …
an10.83:3.3.eng: they ask questions, but don’t actively listen to the teaching …

an10.83:3.4.pli: ohitasoto ca dhammaṃ suṇāti, no ca sutvā dhammaṃ dhāreti …
an10.83:3.4.eng: they actively listen to the teaching, but don’t remember the teaching they’ve heard …

an10.83:3.5.pli: sutvā ca dhammaṃ dhāreti, no ca dhātānaṃ dhammānaṃ atthaṃ upaparikkhati …
an10.83:3.5.eng: they remember the teaching they’ve heard, but don’t examine the meaning of the teachings they’ve remembered …

an10.83:3.6.pli: dhātānañca dhammānaṃ atthaṃ upaparikkhati no ca atthamaññāya dhammamaññāya dhammānudhammappaṭipanno hoti …
an10.83:3.6.eng: they examine the meaning of the teachings they’ve remembered, but, not having understood the meaning and the teaching, they don’t practice in line with the principle of the teaching …

an10.83:3.7.pli: atthamaññāya dhammamaññāya dhammānudhammappaṭipanno ca hoti, no ca kalyāṇavāco hoti kalyāṇavākkaraṇo poriyā vācāya samannāgato vissaṭṭhāya anelagaḷāya atthassa viññāpaniyā …
an10.83:3.7.eng: they practice in line with the teaching, but they’re not a good speaker and do not enunciate well. Their voice is not polished, clear, articulate, and doesn’t express the meaning …

an10.83:3.8.pli: kalyāṇavāco ca hoti kalyāṇavākkaraṇo poriyā vācāya samannāgato vissaṭṭhāya anelagaḷāya atthassa viññāpaniyā, no ca sandassako hoti samādapako samuttejako sampahaṃsako sabrahmacārīnaṃ, neva tāva tathāgataṃ dhammadesanā paṭibhāti.
an10.83:3.8.eng: They’re a good speaker who enunciates well, but they don’t educate, encourage, fire up, and inspire their spiritual companions. The Realized One doesn’t feel inspired to teach.

an10.83:4.1.pli: Yato ca kho, puṇṇiya, bhikkhu saddho ca hoti, upasaṅkamitā ca, payirupāsitā ca, paripucchitā ca, ohitasoto ca dhammaṃ suṇāti, sutvā ca dhammaṃ dhāreti, dhātānañca dhammānaṃ atthaṃ upaparikkhati, atthamaññāya dhammamaññāya dhammānudhammappaṭipanno ca hoti, kalyāṇavāco ca hoti kalyāṇavākkaraṇo poriyā vācāya samannāgato vissaṭṭhāya anelagaḷāya atthassa viññāpaniyā, sandassako ca hoti samādapako samuttejako sampahaṃsako sabrahmacārīnaṃ—
an10.83:4.1.eng: But when a mendicant has faith, approaches, pays homage, asks questions, actively listens to the teachings, remembers the teachings, examines the meaning, practices in line with the principle of the teaching, has a good voice, and encourages their spiritual companions,

an10.83:4.2.eng: the Realized One feels inspired to teach.

an10.83:4.3.pli: Imehi kho, puṇṇiya, dasahi dhammehi samannāgatā ekantapaṭibhānā tathāgataṃ dhammadesanā hotī”ti.
an10.83:4.3.eng: When someone possesses these ten qualities, the Realized One feels totally inspired to teach.”

an10.84:1.1.pli: Tatra kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno bhikkhū āmantesi:
an10.84:1.1.eng: There Venerable Mahāmoggallāna addressed the mendicants:

an10.84:1.3.pli: “Āvuso”ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmato mahāmoggallānassa paccassosuṃ.

an10.84:2.2.pli: ‘khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyāti pajānāmī’ti.
an10.84:2.2.eng: ‘I understand: “Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is nothing further for this place.”’

an10.84:2.3.pli: Tamenaṃ tathāgato vā tathāgatasāvako vā jhāyī samāpattikusalo paracittakusalo paracittapariyāyakusalo samanuyuñjati samanuggāhati samanubhāsati.
an10.84:2.3.eng: They’re pursued, pressed, and grilled by the Realized One, or by one of his disciples who is a meditator skilled in attainments, in the minds of others, and in encompassing another’s mind.

an10.84:2.4.pli: So tathāgatena vā tathāgatasāvakena vā jhāyinā samāpattikusalena paracittakusalena paracittapariyāyakusalena samanuyuñjiyamāno samanuggāhiyamāno samanubhāsiyamāno irīṇaṃ āpajjati vicinaṃ āpajjati anayaṃ āpajjati byasanaṃ āpajjati anayabyasanaṃ āpajjati.
an10.84:2.4.eng: Grilled in this way they get stuck or lose their way. They fall to ruin and disaster.

an10.84:3.1.pli: Tamenaṃ tathāgato vā tathāgatasāvako vā jhāyī samāpattikusalo paracittakusalo paracittapariyāyakusalo evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca manasi karoti:
an10.84:3.1.eng: The Realized One or one of his disciples encompasss their mind and investigates:

an10.84:3.2.eng: ‘Why does this venerable declare enlightenment, saying:

an10.84:3.3.pli: khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyāti pajānāmī’ti?
an10.84:3.3.eng: “I understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is nothing further for this place.’?”’

an10.84:4.1.pli: Tamenaṃ tathāgato vā tathāgatasāvako vā jhāyī samāpattikusalo paracittakusalo paracittapariyāyakusalo evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāti:

an10.84:5.2.eng: and often lives with a heart full of anger.

an10.84:5.3.pli: Kodhapariyuṭṭhānaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.
an10.84:5.3.eng: But being full of anger means decline in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.

an10.84:6.3.pli: Upanāhapariyuṭṭhānaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.

an10.84:7.3.pli: Makkhapariyuṭṭhānaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.

an10.84:8.3.pli: Paḷāsapariyuṭṭhānaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.

an10.84:9.3.pli: Issāpariyuṭṭhānaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.

an10.84:10.3.pli: Maccherapariyuṭṭhānaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.

an10.84:11.3.pli: Sāṭheyyapariyuṭṭhānaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.

an10.84:12.3.pli: Māyāpariyuṭṭhānaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.

an10.84:13.2.eng: and often lives with a heart full of desire.

an10.84:13.3.pli: Icchāpariyuṭṭhānaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.
an10.84:13.3.eng: But being full of desire means decline in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.

an10.84:14.1.pli: Sati kho pana ayamāyasmā uttari karaṇīye oramattakena visesādhigamena antarā vosānaṃ āpanno.
an10.84:14.1.eng: When there is still more to be done, this venerable stopped half-way after achieving some trifling distinction.

an10.84:14.2.pli: Antarā vosānagamanaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ’.
an10.84:14.2.eng: But stopping half-way means decline in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.’

an10.84:15.1.pli: So vatāvuso, bhikkhu ‘ime dasa dhamme appahāya imasmiṃ dhammavinaye vuddhiṃ virūḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjissatī’ti netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
an10.84:15.1.eng: It is quite impossible for a mendicant to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training without giving up these ten qualities.

an10.84:15.2.pli: So vatāvuso, bhikkhu ‘ime dasa dhamme pahāya imasmiṃ dhammavinaye vuddhiṃ virūḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjissatī’ti ṭhānametaṃ vijjatī”ti.
an10.84:15.2.eng: It is quite possible for a mendicant to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training after giving up these ten qualities.”

an10.85:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā mahācundo cetīsu viharati sahajātiyaṃ.
an10.85:1.1.eng: At one time Venerable Mahācunda was staying in the land of the Cetīs at Sahajāti.

an10.85:1.2.pli: Tatra kho āyasmā mahācundo bhikkhū āmantesi:

an10.85:1.4.pli: “Āvuso”ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmato mahācundassa paccassosuṃ.

an10.85:2.1.eng: “Take a mendicant who boasts and brags about their achievements:

an10.85:2.2.pli: ‘ahaṃ paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajjāmipi vuṭṭhahāmipi, ahaṃ dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajjāmipi vuṭṭhahāmipi, ahaṃ tatiyaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajjāmipi vuṭṭhahāmipi, ahaṃ catutthaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajjāmipi vuṭṭhahāmipi, ahaṃ ākāsānañcāyatanaṃ samāpajjāmipi vuṭṭhahāmipi, ahaṃ viññāṇañcāyatanaṃ samāpajjāmipi vuṭṭhahāmipi, ahaṃ ākiñcaññāyatanaṃ samāpajjāmipi vuṭṭhahāmipi, ahaṃ nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṃ samāpajjāmipi vuṭṭhahāmipi, ahaṃ saññāvedayitanirodhaṃ samāpajjāmipi vuṭṭhahāmipī’ti.
an10.85:2.2.eng: ‘I enter and emerge from the first absorption, the second absorption, the third absorption, and the fourth absorption. And I enter and emerge from the dimensions of infinite space, infinite consciousness, nothingness, and neither perception nor non-perception. And I enter and emerge from the cessation of perception and feeling.’

an10.85:3.1.pli: Tamenaṃ tathāgato vā tathāgatasāvako vā jhāyī samāpattikusalo paracittakusalo paracittapariyāyakusalo samanuyuñjati samanuggāhati samanubhāsati.
an10.85:3.1.eng: They’re pursued, pressed, and grilled by the Realized One, or by one of his disciples who has the absorptions, and is skilled in attainments, in the minds of others, and in encompassing another’s mind.

an10.85:3.2.pli: So tathāgatena vā tathāgatasāvakena vā jhāyinā samāpattikusalena paracittakusalena paracittapariyāyakusalena samanuyuñjiyamāno samanuggāhiyamāno samanubhāsiyamāno irīṇaṃ āpajjati vicinaṃ āpajjati anayaṃ āpajjati byasanaṃ āpajjati anayabyasanaṃ āpajjati.
an10.85:3.2.eng: Grilled in this way they get stuck or lose their way. They fall to ruin and disaster.

an10.85:4.1.pli: Tamenaṃ tathāgato vā tathāgatasāvako vā jhāyī samāpattikusalo paracittakusalo paracittapariyāyakusalo evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca manasi karoti:
an10.85:4.1.eng: The Realized One or one of his disciples encompasses their mind and investigates:

an10.85:4.2.pli: ‘kiṃ nu kho ayamāyasmā katthī hoti vikatthī adhigamesu—
an10.85:4.2.eng: ‘Why does this venerable boast and brag about their achievements, saying,

an10.85:4.3.eng: “I enter and emerge from the first absorption …

an10.85:4.4.eng: and the cessation of perception and feeling.”’

an10.85:5.1.pli: Tamenaṃ tathāgato vā tathāgatasāvako vā jhāyī samāpattikusalo paracittakusalo paracittapariyāyakusalo evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāti:

an10.85:6.1.pli: ‘Dīgharattaṃ kho ayamāyasmā khaṇḍakārī chiddakārī sabalakārī kammāsakārī na santatakārī na santatavutti sīlesu.
an10.85:6.1.eng: ‘For a long time this venerable’s deeds have been broken, tainted, spotty, and marred. Their deeds and behavior are inconsistent.

an10.85:6.3.pli: Dussilyaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.
an10.85:6.3.eng: and unethical conduct means decline in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.

an10.85:7.2.pli: assaddhiyaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.
an10.85:7.2.eng: and lack of faith means decline …

an10.85:8.1.eng: This venerable is unlearned and unpracticed,

an10.85:8.2.pli: appasaccaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.
an10.85:8.2.eng: and lack of learning means decline …

an10.85:9.1.eng: This venerable is hard to admonish,

an10.85:9.2.pli: dovacassatā kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.
an10.85:9.2.eng: and being hard to admonish means decline …

an10.85:10.2.pli: pāpamittatā kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.

an10.85:11.2.pli: kosajjaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.

an10.85:12.2.pli: muṭṭhassaccaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.

an10.85:13.2.pli: kohaññaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.

an10.85:14.2.pli: dubbharatā kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.

an10.85:15.2.pli: duppaññatā kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ’.
an10.85:15.2.eng: and lack of wisdom means decline in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.’

an10.85:16.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, āvuso, sahāyako sahāyakaṃ evaṃ vadeyya:
an10.85:16.1.eng: Suppose one friend was to say to another:

an10.85:16.2.pli: ‘yadā te, samma, dhanena dhanakaraṇīyaṃ assa, yāceyyāsi maṃ dhanaṃ. Dassāmi te dhanan’ti.
an10.85:16.2.eng: ‘My dear friend, when you need money for some payment, just ask me and I’ll give it.’

an10.85:16.3.pli: So kiñcideva dhanakaraṇīye samuppanne sahāyako sahāyakaṃ evaṃ vadeyya: ‘attho me, samma, dhanena. Dehi me dhanan’ti.
an10.85:16.3.eng: Then when some payment falls due, that friend says to their friend: ‘I need some money, my dear friend. Give me some.’

an10.85:16.5.pli: ‘tena hi, samma, idha khanāhī’ti. So tatra khananto nādhigaccheyya.
an10.85:16.5.eng: ‘Well then, my dear friend, dig here.’ So they dig there, but don’t find anything.

an10.85:16.7.pli: ‘alikaṃ maṃ, samma, avaca; tucchakaṃ maṃ, samma, avaca—idha khanāhī’ti.
an10.85:16.7.eng: ‘You lied to me, my dear friend, you spoke hollow words when you told me to dig here.’

an10.85:16.9.pli: ‘nāhaṃ taṃ, samma, alikaṃ avacaṃ, tucchakaṃ avacaṃ. Tena hi, samma, idha khanāhī’ti.
an10.85:16.9.eng: ‘My dear friend, I didn’t lie or speak hollow words. Well then, dig here.’

an10.85:16.10.eng: So they dig there as well, but don’t find anything.

an10.85:16.12.pli: ‘alikaṃ maṃ, samma, avaca, tucchakaṃ maṃ, samma, avaca—idha khanāhī’ti.
an10.85:16.12.eng: ‘You lied to me, my dear friend, you spoke hollow words when you said dig here.’

an10.85:16.14.pli: ‘nāhaṃ taṃ, samma, alikaṃ avacaṃ, tucchakaṃ avacaṃ. Tena hi, samma, idha khanāhī’ti.
an10.85:16.14.eng: ‘My dear friend, I didn’t lie or speak hollow words. Well then, dig here.’

an10.85:16.15.eng: So they dig there as well, but don’t find anything.

an10.85:16.17.pli: ‘alikaṃ maṃ, samma, avaca, tucchakaṃ maṃ, samma, avaca—idha khanāhī’ti.
an10.85:16.17.eng: ‘You lied to me, my dear friend, you spoke hollow words when you said dig here.’

an10.85:16.19.pli: ‘nāhaṃ taṃ, samma, alikaṃ avacaṃ, tucchakaṃ avacaṃ. Api ca ahameva ummādaṃ pāpuṇiṃ cetaso vipariyāyan’ti.
an10.85:16.19.eng: ‘My dear friend, I didn’t lie or speak hollow words. But I had gone mad, I was out of my mind.’

an10.85:17.1.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, āvuso, bhikkhu katthī hoti vikatthī adhigamesu:
an10.85:17.1.eng: In the same way, take a mendicant who boasts and brags about their achievements:

an10.85:17.2.pli: ‘ahaṃ paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajjāmipi vuṭṭhahāmipi, ahaṃ dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajjāmipi vuṭṭhahāmipi, ahaṃ tatiyaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajjāmipi vuṭṭhahāmipi, ahaṃ catutthaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajjāmipi vuṭṭhahāmipi, ahaṃ ākāsānañcāyatanaṃ samāpajjāmipi vuṭṭhahāmipi, ahaṃ viññāṇañcāyatanaṃ samāpajjāmipi vuṭṭhahāmipi, ahaṃ ākiñcaññāyatanaṃ samāpajjāmipi vuṭṭhahāmipi, ahaṃ nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṃ samāpajjāmipi vuṭṭhahāmipi, ahaṃ saññāvedayitanirodhaṃ samāpajjāmipi vuṭṭhahāmipī’ti.
an10.85:17.2.eng: ‘I enter and emerge from the first absorption … and the cessation of perception and feeling.’

an10.85:18.1.pli: Tamenaṃ tathāgato vā tathāgatasāvako vā jhāyī samāpattikusalo paracittakusalo paracittapariyāyakusalo samanuyuñjati samanuggāhati samanubhāsati.
an10.85:18.1.eng: They’re pursued, pressed, and grilled by the Realized One, or by one of his disciples …

an10.85:18.2.pli: So tathāgatena vā tathāgatasāvakena vā jhāyinā samāpattikusalena paracittakusalena paracittapariyāyakusalena samanuyuñjiyamāno samanuggāhiyamāno samanubhāsiyamāno irīṇaṃ āpajjati vicinaṃ āpajjati anayaṃ āpajjati byasanaṃ āpajjati anayabyasanaṃ āpajjati.
an10.85:18.2.eng: Grilled in this way they get stuck or lose their way. They fall to ruin and disaster.

an10.85:19.1.pli: Tamenaṃ tathāgato vā tathāgatasāvako vā jhāyī samāpattikusalo paracittakusalo paracittapariyāyakusalo evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca manasi karoti:
an10.85:19.1.eng: The Realized One or one of his disciples encompasses their mind and investigates:

an10.85:19.2.pli: ‘kiṃ nu kho ayamāyasmā katthī hoti vikatthī adhigamesu—
an10.85:19.2.eng: ‘Why does this venerable boast and brag about their achievements, saying,

an10.85:19.3.eng: “I enter and emerge from the first absorption …

an10.85:19.4.eng: and the cessation of perception and feeling.”’

an10.85:20.1.pli: Tamenaṃ tathāgato vā tathāgatasāvako vā jhāyī samāpattikusalo paracittapariyāyakusalo cetasā ceto paricca pajānāti:

an10.85:21.1.pli: ‘Dīgharattaṃ kho ayamāyasmā khaṇḍakārī chiddakārī sabalakārī kammāsakārī, na santatakārī na santatavutti sīlesu.
an10.85:21.1.eng: ‘For a long time this venerable’s deeds have been broken, tainted, spotty, and marred. Their deeds and behavior are inconsistent.

an10.85:21.3.pli: dussilyaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.
an10.85:21.3.eng: and unethical conduct means decline in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.

an10.85:22.2.pli: assaddhiyaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.

an10.85:23.2.pli: appasaccaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.

an10.85:24.2.pli: dovacassatā kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.

an10.85:25.2.pli: pāpamittatā kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.

an10.85:26.2.pli: kosajjaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.

an10.85:27.2.pli: muṭṭhassaccaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.

an10.85:28.2.pli: kohaññaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.

an10.85:29.2.pli: dubbharatā kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.

an10.85:30.2.pli: duppaññatā kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ’.
an10.85:30.2.eng: and lack of wisdom means decline in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.’

an10.85:31.1.pli: So vatāvuso, bhikkhu ‘ime dasa dhamme appahāya imasmiṃ dhammavinaye vuddhiṃ virūḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjissatī’ti netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
an10.85:31.1.eng: It is quite impossible for a mendicant to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training without giving up these ten qualities.

an10.85:31.2.pli: So vatāvuso, bhikkhu ‘ime dasa dhamme pahāya imasmiṃ dhammavinaye vuddhiṃ virūḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjissatī’ti ṭhānametaṃ vijjatī”ti.
an10.85:31.2.eng: It is quite possible for a mendicant to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training after giving up these ten qualities.”

an10.86:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā mahākassapo rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
an10.86:1.1.eng: At one time Venerable Mahākassapa was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.

an10.86:1.2.pli: Tatra kho āyasmā mahākassapo bhikkhū āmantesi:

an10.86:1.4.pli: “Āvuso”ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmato mahākassapassa paccassosuṃ.

an10.86:2.2.pli: ‘khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyāti pajānāmī’ti.
an10.86:2.2.eng: ‘I understand: “Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is nothing further for this place.”’

an10.86:2.3.pli: Tamenaṃ tathāgato vā tathāgatasāvako vā jhāyī samāpattikusalo paracittakusalo paracittapariyāyakusalo samanuyuñjati samanuggāhati samanubhāsati.
an10.86:2.3.eng: They’re pursued, pressed, and grilled by the Realized One, or by one of his disciples who has the absorptions, and is skilled in attainments, in the minds of others, and in encompassing another’s mind.

an10.86:2.4.pli: So tathāgatena vā tathāgatasāvakena vā jhāyinā samāpattikusalena paracittakusalena paracittapariyāyakusalena samanuyuñjiyamāno samanuggāhiyamāno samanubhāsiyamāno irīṇaṃ āpajjati vicinaṃ āpajjati anayaṃ āpajjati byasanaṃ āpajjati anayabyasanaṃ āpajjati.
an10.86:2.4.eng: Grilled in this way they get stuck or lose their way. They fall to ruin and disaster.

an10.86:3.1.pli: Tamenaṃ tathāgato vā tathāgatasāvako vā jhāyī samāpattikusalo paracittakusalo paracittapariyāyakusalo evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca manasi karoti:
an10.86:3.1.eng: The Realized One or one of his disciples encompasses their mind and investigates:

an10.86:3.2.eng: ‘Why does this venerable declare enlightenment, saying,

an10.86:3.3.pli: khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyāti pajānāmī’ti.
an10.86:3.3.eng: “I understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is nothing further for this place.’?”’

an10.86:4.1.pli: Tamenaṃ tathāgato vā tathāgatasāvako vā jhāyī samāpattikusalo paracittakusalo paracittapariyāyakusalo evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāti:

an10.86:5.1.pli: ‘Adhimāniko kho ayamāyasmā adhimānasacco, appatte pattasaññī, akate katasaññī, anadhigate adhigatasaññī.
an10.86:5.1.eng: ‘This venerable overestimates themselves and takes that to be the truth. They perceive that they’ve attained what they haven’t attained, done what they haven’t done, and achieved what they haven’t achieved.

an10.86:5.2.eng: And they declare enlightenment out of overestimation:

an10.86:5.3.pli: khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyāti pajānāmī’ti.
an10.86:5.3.eng: “I understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is nothing further for this place.’”’

an10.86:6.1.pli: Tamenaṃ tathāgato vā tathāgatasāvako vā jhāyī samāpattikusalo paracittakusalo paracittapariyāyakusalo evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca manasi karoti:
an10.86:6.1.eng: The Realized One or one of his disciples encompasses their mind and investigates:

an10.86:6.2.pli: ‘kiṃ nu kho ayamāyasmā nissāya adhimāniko adhimānasacco, appatte pattasaññī, akate katasaññī, anadhigate adhigatasaññī.
an10.86:6.2.eng: ‘Why does this venerable overestimate themselves and take that to be the truth? Why do they perceive that they’ve attained what they haven’t attained, done what they haven’t done, and achieved what they haven’t achieved?

an10.86:6.3.eng: And why do they declare enlightenment out of overestimation:

an10.86:6.4.pli: khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyāti pajānāmī’ti.
an10.86:6.4.eng: “I understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is nothing further for this place.’”’

an10.86:7.1.pli: Tamenaṃ tathāgato vā tathāgatasāvako vā jhāyī samāpattikusalo paracittakusalo paracittapariyāyakusalo evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāti:

an10.86:8.1.pli: ‘Bahussuto kho pana ayamāyasmā sutadharo sutasannicayo, ye te dhammā ādikalyāṇā majjhekalyāṇā pariyosānakalyāṇā sātthaṃ sabyañjanaṃ kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ abhivadanti, tathārūpāssa dhammā bahussutā honti dhātā vacasā paricitā manasānupekkhitā diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā.
an10.86:8.1.eng: ‘This venerable is very learned, remembering and keeping what they’ve learned. These teachings are good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased, describing a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure. They are very learned in such teachings, remembering them, rehearsing them, mentally scrutinizing them, and penetrating them theoretically.

an10.86:8.2.pli: Tasmā ayamāyasmā adhimāniko adhimānasacco, appatte pattasaññī, akate katasaññī, anadhigate adhigatasaññī.
an10.86:8.2.eng: Therefore this venerable overestimates themselves and takes that to be the truth. …’

an10.86:8.4.pli: khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyāti pajānāmī’ti.

an10.86:9.1.pli: Tamenaṃ tathāgato vā tathāgatasāvako vā jhāyī samāpattikusalo paracittakusalo paracittapariyāyakusalo evaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāti:

an10.86:10.2.eng: and often lives with a heart full covetousness.

an10.86:10.3.pli: Abhijjhāpariyuṭṭhānaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.
an10.86:10.3.eng: Being full of covetousness means decline in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.

an10.86:11.3.pli: Byāpādapariyuṭṭhānaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.

an10.86:12.3.pli: Thinamiddhapariyuṭṭhānaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.

an10.86:13.3.pli: Uddhaccapariyuṭṭhānaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.

an10.86:14.3.pli: Vicikicchāpariyuṭṭhānaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.

an10.86:15.1.pli: Kammārāmo kho pana ayamāyasmā kammarato kammārāmataṃ anuyutto.
an10.86:15.1.eng: This venerable relishes work. They love it and like to relish it …

an10.86:15.2.pli: Kammārāmatā kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.

an10.86:16.1.pli: Bhassārāmo kho pana ayamāyasmā bhassarato bhassārāmataṃ anuyutto.

an10.86:16.2.pli: Bhassārāmatā kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.

an10.86:17.1.pli: Niddārāmo kho pana ayamāyasmā niddārato niddārāmataṃ anuyutto.

an10.86:17.2.pli: Niddārāmatā kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.

an10.86:18.1.pli: Saṅgaṇikārāmo kho pana ayamāyasmā saṅgaṇikarato saṅgaṇikārāmataṃ anuyutto.

an10.86:18.2.pli: Saṅgaṇikārāmatā kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ.

an10.86:19.1.pli: Sati kho pana ayamāyasmā uttari karaṇīye oramattakena visesādhigamena antarā vosānaṃ āpanno.
an10.86:19.1.eng: When there is still more to be done, this venerable stopped half-way after achieving some trifling distinction.

an10.86:19.2.pli: Antarā vosānagamanaṃ kho pana tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye parihānametaṃ’.
an10.86:19.2.eng: Stopping half-way means decline in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.’

an10.86:20.1.pli: So vatāvuso, bhikkhu ‘ime dasa dhamme appahāya imasmiṃ dhammavinaye vuddhiṃ virūḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjissatī’ti netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
an10.86:20.1.eng: It is quite impossible for a mendicant to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training without giving up these ten qualities.

an10.86:20.2.pli: So vatāvuso, bhikkhu ‘ime dasa dhamme pahāya imasmiṃ dhammavinaye vuddhiṃ virūḷhiṃ vepullaṃ āpajjissatī’ti ṭhānametaṃ vijjatī”ti.
an10.86:20.2.eng: It is quite possible for a mendicant to achieve growth, improvement, or maturity in this teaching and training after giving up these ten qualities.”
